alert.note: Alert for Coastal Onslow; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 04 at 3:23PM EDT until June 04 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, strong longshore currents in the surf zone. * WHERE...Coastal Onslow County, and Ocracoke Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 2 AM EDT Monday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. High tide is in between 8 and 10 PM tonight. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Strong longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties and other hazardous areas. In many cases, the longshore current is strong enough to prevent swimmers from being able to keep their feet on the bottom making it difficult to return to shore.
